intro: Psiadia dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets, creating a daisy-like appearance. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Psiadia dimorpha is often used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
